purpose: Extend the N12_58 clock/anchor picture to the aut=6 class (N12_54, N12_57) and identify the distinguished missing-triangle orbit that plays the role of the tau-fixed anchors.
finding: For aut=6 manifolds, missing triangles split into 29 full orbits of size 6 and one special orbit of size 2. The order-3 generator fixes the two special triangles individually, while an order-2 generator swaps them, realizing a Z6 clock action on a distinguished anchor pair.
interpretation_notes: This aut=6 kernel is the reduced analogue of the N12_58 story: a Z3 action (tau) with distinguished fixed anchors, and a Z2 action that exchanges the anchors, combining to a Z6 clock on the anchor subsystem.
Unlike N12_58, there is no V4 refinement visible in the missing-triangle orbit structure; the natural sector layer is Z2 (the swapped pair) rather than Z2×Z2.
These aut=6 manifolds are strong candidates for a 'subkernel' embedding into the N12_58 kernel by restricting to a single defect-family bit and its associated Z3.
